intro: Baeria chrysostoma subsp. hirsutula, commonly known as the hairy baeria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are often pubescent, providing a distinctive appearance and aiding in water retention. This subspecies is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
